title.value: Особенности состава гумуса дерново-подзолистых заболоченных почв с иллювиально-гумусовым горизонтом на территории Брестского Полесья [Беларусь]
Features of the humus composition of sod-podzolic soils of wetlands with illuvial-humus horizon at the Brest Polessye [Belarus]
Features of the humus composition of sod-podzolic soils of wetlands with illuvial-humus horizon at the Brest Polessye [Belarus]

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Klebanovich, N.V., Belarus State Univ., Minsk (Belarus)
Domas, A.S., Brest State Univ. named after A.S. Pushkin, Brest  (Belarus)

abstract.value: In course of the research there were studied humus peculiarities of podzols of Brest Polesye (Brest region of the Republic of Belarus). As a result of realized research there were revealed the data of content and composition of humus in the profile of podzols of the territory. They have much organic carbon, up to 10% in topsoil and have also second maximum of organic carbon in Bh horizon. Feature of the organic matter distribution in soils with illuvial-humus horizon in the research area was bimodal, with two peaks distribution of total organic carbon and non-hydrolysable residue. Fulvic-humate composition of the humus horizon was due to an increased content of fraction 1 humic acids. The value of Cha / Cfk significantly decreased down the profile, acquiring a distinct character of fulvic in illuvial-humus horizon, due to a significant increase in the fraction 1a fulvic acid, as well as a significant decrease in the proportion of fraction 1 humic acids.
